intro: Chasmone ascendens, commonly known as the climbing chasmone, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is a perennial shrub that typically grows in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its leaves are alternate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Chasmone ascendens is notable for its ability to climb using its twining stems, often found in woodland or coastal areas.
